18
19namespace ZXing {
20
21class BitMatrix;
22class ResultPoint;
23
24/**
25* <p>
26* Detects a candidate barcode-like rectangular region within an image. It
27* starts around the center of the image, increases the size of the candidate
28* region until it finds a white rectangular region. By keeping track of the
29* last black points it encountered, it determines the corners of the barcode.
30* </p>
31*
32* @author David Olivier
33*/
34class WhiteRectDetector
35{
36public:
37 /**
38 * <p>
39 * Detects a candidate barcode-like rectangular region within an image. It
40 * starts around the center of the image, increases the size of the candidate
41 * region until it finds a white rectangular region.
42 * </p>
43 *
44 * @param image barcode image to find a rectangle in
45 * @param initSize initial size of search area around center
46 * @param x x position of search center
47 * @param y y position of search center
48 * @return {@link ResultPoint}[] describing the corners of the rectangular
49 * region. The first and last points are opposed on the diagonal, as
50 * are the second and third. The first point will be the topmost
51 * point and the last, the bottommost. The second point will be
52 * leftmost and the third, the rightmost
53 * @throws NotFoundException if no Data Matrix Code can be found
54 */
55 static bool Detect(const BitMatrix& image, int initSize, int x, int y, ResultPoint& p0, ResultPoint& p1, ResultPoint& p2, ResultPoint& p3);
56 static bool Detect(const BitMatrix& image, ResultPoint& p0, ResultPoint& p1, ResultPoint& p2, ResultPoint& p3);
57};
58
59} // ZXing
60
